docs.lead_paragraph: Early evidence suggests that the tax credit subsidies at the core of President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law likely helped expand U.S. health insurance coverage last year, Congress's non-partisan research arm said on Monday.

headline.main: Obamacare Subsidies Likely Expanded Insurance Coverage: Report
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Subsidies Likely Expanded Insurance Coverage: Report

docs.snippet: Early evidence suggests that the tax credit subsidies at the core of President Barack Obama's healthcare reform law likely helped expand U.S. health insurance coverage last year, Congress's non-partisan research arm said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The costs of caring for the uninsured at U.S. hospitals fell by an estimated $7.4 billion in 2014 due to the expansion of healthcare to millions of people under Obamacare, according to a government report released on Monday.

headline.main: U.S. Hospitals' Uncompensated Care Fell by $7.4 Billion in 2014: Government
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hospitals' Uncompensated Care Fell by $7.4 Billion in 2014: Government

docs.snippet: The costs of caring for the uninsured at U.S. hospitals fell by an estimated $7.4 billion in 2014 due to the expansion of healthcare to millions of people under Obamacare, according to a government report released on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Humana plans to sell occupational health care provider Concentra for about $1.06 billion, as the health insurer refines its focus on providing patient care.

headline.main: Humana to Narrow Focus Outside Insurance With Concentra Sale
headline.print_headline: Humana to Narrow Focus Outside Insurance With Concentra Sale

docs.snippet: Humana plans to sell occupational health care provider Concentra for about $1.06 billion, as the health insurer refines its focus on providing patient care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today is Tuesday, March 24, the 83rd day of 2015. There are 282 days left in the year.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that because of the Affordable Care Act, the disease is being diagnosed earlier in poor Americans.

headline.main: With Expansion of Medicaid, Some States Are Identifying More New Diabetes Cases
headline.print_headline: With Expansion of Medicaid, Some States Are Identifying More New Diabetes Cases

docs.abstract: Quest Diagnostics study published in journal Diabetes Care finds spike in number of new diabetes diagnoses among poor Americans in states that have embraced Affordable Care Act and have expanded Medicaid program; study suggests that law may be aiding thousands of people in receiving earlier treatment for condition.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that because of the Affordable Care Act, the disease is being diagnosed earlier in poor Americans.

docs.lead_paragraph: While the disease has not been eliminated, aid groups take stock of what worked and didn’t, and continue to point fingers.

headline.main: One Year Later, Ebola Outbreak Offers Lessons for Next Epidemic
headline.print_headline: One Year Later, Ebola Outbreak Offers Lessons for Next Epidemic

docs.abstract: Governments and relief organizations around world take of stock of mistakes made in responding to Ebola outbreak in Liberia, Sierra Leone and Guinea; lessons learned may help limit future epidemics.
docs.snippet: While the disease has not been eliminated, aid groups take stock of what worked and didn’t, and continue to point fingers.

docs.lead_paragraph: A deal to protect fees of doctors for treating Medicare beneficiaries was negotiated by Speaker John A. Boehner and the House Democratic leader, Nancy Pelosi.

headline.main: Congress to Weigh a Plan to Protect Medicare Fees and Children’s Insurance
headline.print_headline: Congress to Weigh a Plan to Protect Medicare Fees and Children’s Insurance

docs.abstract: Negotiations led by House Speaker John A Boehner and Rep Nancy Pelosi are near agreement concerning changes to Medicare formulas for reimbursing doctors and rewarding them for performance; bill will also extend Children's Health Insurance Program, and would be significant accomplishment for Boehner.
docs.snippet: A deal to protect fees of doctors for treating Medicare beneficiaries was negotiated by Speaker John A. Boehner and the House Democratic leader, Nancy Pelosi.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the most expensive patients — so-called super utilizers of hospital care — rack up costs for avoidable reasons. Experiments across the country are trying to better manage these cases.

headline.main: Health Care Systems Try to Cut Costs by Aiding the Poor and Troubled
headline.print_headline: Ounce of Prevention: Health Care Systems Try to Cut Costs by Aiding Poor

docs.abstract: Pilot program in Hennepin County, Minn, which encompasses Minneapolis, is one of many in country that seeks to better manage cases of so-called super utilizers of hospital care, who are often poor, homeless, or suffer from mental illness or addiction; Hennepin program focuses on 10,000 people and tries to fix their problems before they evolve into serious medical issues; such programs have raised questions of degree to which health system has role in tackling issues like poverty.
docs.snippet: Some of the most expensive patients — so-called super utilizers of hospital care — rack up costs for avoidable reasons. Experiments across the country are trying to better manage these cases.

docs.lead_paragraph: When President Barack Obama signed the Affordable Care Act five years ago, he visualized a time when the political hyperbole would be silenced and ordinary people would see that the health care law improved their lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: Under the Affordable Care Act, people who remained uninsured last year must either pay a penalty with their taxes or claim an exemption.

headline.main: Under Health Care Act, Many Tax Filers Are Discovering Costly Complications
headline.print_headline: Under Health Act, Many Tax Filers Are Discovering Costly Complications

docs.abstract: Many Americans filing 2014 taxes are for first time grappling with effects of gaining insurance under Affordable Care Act, including confusing new tax forms and unexpected fees.
docs.snippet: Under the Affordable Care Act, people who remained uninsured last year must either pay a penalty with their taxes or claim an exemption.
